name: Vegan Blondies
description: Soft, buttery Vegan Blondies give regular brownies a run for their money. Loaded with vegan white chocolate chips, these are seriously the best dessert bars ever!
recipeIngredient: 1/2-3/4 cup vegan white chocolate chips (or regular chocolate chips)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a 8 inch square baking pan with parchment paper, leaving overhang on the sides for easy removal.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F and line a 8 inch square baking pan with parchment paper, leaving overhang on the sides for easy removal.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt the butter in a microwave safe mixing bowl for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt the butter in a microwave safe mixing bowl for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, stir the melted vegan butter with the brown sugar until smooth like caramel. Now add the applesauce and vanilla and stir to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, stir the melted vegan butter with the brown sugar until smooth like caramel. Now add the applesauce and vanilla and stir to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the flour, baking powder and salt to the wet mixture and stir until just combined. The dough will be a bit thick and sticky.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the flour, baking powder and salt to the wet mixture and stir until just combined. The dough will be a bit thick and sticky.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the white chocolate chips (or regular chocolate chips). Use your hands if needed to get them evenly dispersed.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the white chocolate chips (or regular chocolate chips). Use your hands if needed to get them evenly dispersed.

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan and press down evenly with your hands or a spatula. Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the top is set and the blondies are golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan and press down evenly with your hands or a spatula. Bake for 25-30 minutes, until the top is set and the blondies are golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the bars cool for 15 minutes in the pan, them lift them out using the parchment paper and let cool on a cooling rack for another 20 minutes, if you can wait that long! Slice into squares and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Let the bars cool for 15 minutes in the pan, them lift them out using the parchment paper and let cool on a cooling rack for another 20 minutes, if you can wait that long! Slice into squares and enjoy!

recipeInstructions.text: To store: Keep leftover blondies in a covered container for up to 5 days or freeze for longer.
recipeInstructions.name: To store: Keep leftover blondies in a covered container for up to 5 days or freeze for longer.
